etymologies: late 16th century (as passeflower): from French passe-fleur. The change in spelling of the first word was due to association with archaic pasque ‘Easter’ (because of the plant's early flowering)

definitions: a spring-flowering plant of the buttercup family, with purple or white flowers.

notes.text: Genera Anemone and Pulsatilla, family Ranunculaceae: several species, in particular the North American A. patens and the Eurasian P. vulgaris

shortDefinitions: spring-flowering European plant related to anemones
